replies.msg:
Chelsea confirm deal to sign Leon Bailey from Bayer Leverkusen

Chelsea has completed the first signing of summer at €60m (£53.7m) capture of Leon Bailey from Bayer Leverkusen in a move that will further strengthen his options in the attacking line behind the striker.

Bailey, who is most comfortable on the left wing where he can cut inside on to his favoured left foot, but can also play as a sticker, has been a long-standing Chelsea target, having first come to the club's attention with his performance for Leverkusen in the Bundesliga .

The deal for him had been at an advanced stage for several months but Leverkusen did not want to confirm it until they had signed a replacement. They did so on Thursday lunchtime when they announced that the sticker Jann-Fiete Arp had joined from Hamburg which, in turn, allowed Chelsea soon to release a statement on their website that Bailey had signed subject to the successful completion of a medical.

Chelsea transfer news: Maurizio Sarri demands £179m for FOUR deals as appointment looms

The main target is centre-back Kalidou Koulibaly, who isa violable for £79m.

Chelsea are the only real contenders for Koulibaly as fellow suitors Barcelona instead focus on keeping Samuel Umtiti at their club.

Gazzetta claim Sarri also wants to sign right-back Elseid Hysaj and midfielder Piotr ZieliÅ„ski from Napoli.

The pair are available for a combined £100m and Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis would be unable to block either deal going through if Chelsea triggered their release clauses.

On top of the Napoli trio, Gazzetta report that a swap deal between Alvaro Morata and Gonzalo Higuain is also on the cards.

They claim Chelsea are determined to recoup the £60m they paid Real Madrid for Morata less than 12 months ago.

Rubbish source:

Chelsea step up Leon Bailey move as Manchester City close in on Riyad Mahrez

Chelsea have stepped up their interest in Bayer Leverkusen winger Leon Bailey with a view to signing the forward this summer, Metro.co.uk understands.

The 20-year-old is being tracked by a number of Premier League clubs after an eye-catching season in the Bundesliga, where the Jamaica-born winger scored nine times in 30 appearances.

Manchester City had been keen on Bailey with Pep Guardiola valuing the youngster’s ability to play anywhere across the attack. However, City are closing in on a deal for Leicester City star Riyad Mahrez and are unlikely to pursue a move for Bailey this summer.

That has created a window of opportunity for Chelsea and Metro.co.uk understands the club’s interest in Bailey has increased dramatically in recent weeks.

Pulisic can play on either the left or the right side, or as a central attacking midfielder and his versatility would be a huge plus for Pochettino as he looks for ways to strengthen his squad.

Liverpool and Chelsea have already been linked with Pulisic and Dortmund’s interest in signing Michy Batshuayi on a permanent deal could encourage the Blues.

Dortmund currently value Pulisic at around £50million and it remains to be seen whether Spurs or any other Premier League club is prepared to get near to that price.
